entries.meaning: (sociology) The group of people who do not belong to one's own social group.
(systematics) In cladistics, all the taxa included in a study that do not belong to the ingroup that is of immediate interest.
examples: A cladistic analysis of 45 ingroup and two outgroup taxa was performed on the basis of 134 characters.

verbs.description: outgroup (third-person singular simple present outgroups, present participle outgrouping, simple past and past participle outgrouped)
